feed.title: SAP Community - SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
feed.subtitle: SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Q&A in SAP Community

entry.title: The non-valuation of inter-projects and intra-projects stock transfers PUBLIC CLOUD
entry.content:
Subject: Inconsistent Valuation on Project-to-Project Stock Transfers (Mvt Type 344 Q and Mvt Type 343 Q)  

Dear SAP Experts, 

We are facing a critical issue with project-to-project stock transfers where the accounting posting for the stock valuation is inconsistent. Sometimes the transfer correctly generates a financial document, and other times it does not, despite using the exact same procedure. 

Business Process: 
We perform stock transfers of valuated project stock (Q-stock) between two different WBS Elements belonging to different projects. 

Applications : Transfer Stock Cross-Plant, Transfer Stock In Plant 

Movement Type: 344,343 (Special Stock Q) 

Problem Description: 

The expected behavior for a transfer posting with movement type 344 Q is the creation of both a Material Document for the quantity transfer and a corresponding Accounting Document for the value transfer. 

However, the system is failing to perform the value transfer. It only executes the physical quantity movement, leading to a critical data inconsistency: 

Receiving Project: The stock quantity is correctly increased, but it is received with zero value. 

Sending Project: The stock quantity is correctly reduced (often to zero), but it improperly retains the full inventory value. 

This results in a severe mismatch where the sending project has a monetary value with no associated stock, and the receiving project has stock with no value, corrupting our project cost and inventory reporting. 

We have been unable to identify a pattern or reason for this inconsistency. It occurs with the same material type, same movement type, and between similar project structures.

entry.title: Goods receipt to special stock type E for the cross-company code returns process.
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support,

We are currently implementing the cross-company sales process and have set up the corresponding returns process in accordance with Scope Item 2F4. During testing, we observed that when posting the goods receipt for a return, the system does not assign Special Stock Type "E" (Orders on Hand), but instead posts the stock to Blocked Stock without any Special Stock Type.

This issue seems restricted to the context of cross-company returns. For example, if both sales organization and return plant are under the same company code, the Special Stock “E” assignment works correctly.

We have confirmed that our item category, schedule line category, movement type (657), and plant configuration are correctly maintained. However, the expected special stock behavior is missing only for cross-company returns.

Can you please clarify:

  • Is this standard system behavior in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition?
  • If yes, what is the recommendation for tracking returned stock by sales order in such scenarios?
  • Are there workarounds or extensibility options available?

Thank you in advance.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: S/4HANA Public Cloud 2508 Migration Cockpit: Material Does Not Exist Or Is Not Activated
entry.content:
I am running data migration activities in the public cloud edition using the migration cockpit application, specifically, I am working on migrating material master data using the standard "Product" template.

I have successfully uploaded the file and passed through the mapping tasks and the preparation steps, but when I attempt to run a simulation, I keep getting this error message:

"The material 1 does not exist or is not activated"

 

I've looked through the template and all of the mandatory fields have been filled in correctly, and there are no other field specific validation/mapping issues that would be causing this. There are unfortunately no other details that would help pinpoint the root cause of these errors.

Has anyone had a similar experience and how did you resolve it?

entry.title: Bank Guarantee as noted item in SAP Public Cloud
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

May i know how to post bank guarantee as noted item in SAP Public Cloud?

entry.title: 在创建应付汇票时，需要进行存应付汇票保证金，如汇票金额10000.00元，需要存汇票保证金3000.00元，如何跟汇票绑定，且在汇票中看到保证金金额及汇票情况；请指教？

entry.title: How to define business place for Taiwan?
entry.content:
When defining the business place for Taiwan in the activity configuration "Define Business Place" (ID:102847), the error "The company code you entered is not located in any of the countries/regions where the business place functions are supported" occurred.


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Best practices for splitting software collections with dependency safety
entry.content:
In our SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition environment, we currently group non-role-related changes (e.g., UI extensions, logic, configurations) into a single software collection due to dependency concerns.

However, since software collections cannot be released independently (no "overtaking"), we're facing a challenge where delays in a few objects block the release of all others in the same collection.

Given this, we’re looking for any practical best practices or decision rules for how to split software collections that:

  • Avoid import errors caused by object dependencies, and

  • Allow more flexible, decoupled release cycles

If anyone has defined objective rules, patterns, or decision flows for structuring collections under these constraints, I would greatly appreciate your input.

entry.title: API Inbound Delivery SAP_COM_0224 API Error deliveryrequest_in
entry.content:
Currently Im trying to implement the Indbound delivery as SOAP API SAP_COM_0224. 

 

sap-vdm-sot-InboundDelivery-v1

 

https://api.sap.com/api/DELIVERYREQUEST_IN/overview

 

When trying to Create a Inbound delivery using the Tool SOAP UI i always get Tons of Error messages like "Authorizationd denied" and "Wrong SOAP Version" 

 

At this moment i did try it all. SOAP V1.1, SOAP 1.2 with there according SAOP envelopes. 

 

This is our endpoint: https://myXXXXXX-api.s4hana.cloud.sap/sap/bc/srt/scs_ext/sap/deliveryrequest_in?MessageId=916C6E5X-3BB2-11CA-A054-08002B1BB6K9 

Neither the S/4 Error Messages nor the Documentation of api.sap.com help me at this point. therefore i was creating the Ticket. 

Do i miss anything?

This is my preferred Payload: 

 

<soapenv:Envelope xmlns:soapenv="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/" xmlns:edi="http://sap.com/xi/EDI">
<soap:Header/>
<soap:Body>
<edi:DeliveryRequest>
<MessageHeader>
<CreationDateTime>2025-08-06T15:39:04Z</CreationDateTime>
</MessageHeader>
<Delivery>
<Party PartyType="VN">
<SupplierPartyID>1</SupplierPartyID>
</Party>
<GoodsIssueDateTime timeZoneCode="CET">2025-08-06T15:39:04Z</GoodsIssueDateTime>
<DeliveryDateTime timeZoneCode="CET">2026-08-06T15:39:04Z</DeliveryDateTime>
<DeliveryItem>
<UnderlyingPurchaseOrder>4500000037</UnderlyingPurchaseOrder>
<UnderlyingPurchaseOrderItem>10</UnderlyingPurchaseOrderItem>
</DeliveryItem>
<DeliveryItem>
<UnderlyingPurchaseOrder>4500000037</UnderlyingPurchaseOrder>
<UnderlyingPurchaseOrderItem>20</UnderlyingPurchaseOrderItem>
</DeliveryItem>
</Delivery>
</edi:DeliveryRequest>
</soap:Body>
</soap:Envelope>

 

 

 

I also tried the Example stated in the API Documentation: 

 

 

 

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<soap:Envelope xmlns:soap="http://www.w3.org/2003/05/soap-envelope" xmlns:edi="http://sap.com/xi/EDI">

                            <SupplierProductID>CARTON</SupplierProductID>

                    </Load>

entry.title: Which BADI program we can use to change the PO delivery date?
entry.content:
Dear Community,

We are using SAP Public Cloud 2502 version, (will be upgraded to 2508 soon), we had a requirement, for sales with order-specific procurement, if the delivery date of SO is Oct.8th, the delivery date of the related PO should be minus 7 days Oct.1st (this is just a sample, the actual rule is more complicated than this one).

Therefore, we need a BADI to write some codings, to let us realize this requirement.

We checked BADI MM_PUR_S4_PO_MODIFY_ITEM, but delivery date cannot be changed.

Could you please how to realize the above requirement, or any other BADI can be used? Thank you very much.

Here is the BADI screenshots, for your reference.

Best Regards,

Grace

entry.title: Incorrect Pricing Condition Assigned During EDI Sales Order Creation via SAP_COM_0223
entry.content:
Hello experts, 

I am creating a sales order via EDI using the SAP_COM_0223 communication arrangement (scope item 2EL) in SAP S/4 Public Cloud .

The sales order is created, but we've noticed an issue with the pricing conditions: the system is assigning the ZPS0 condition record, which is typically used for intercompany pricing.

However, for EDI-based sales orders, the correct pricing condition should be ZPR0. Could you help us understand why ZPS0 is being picked up instead of ZPR0, and what configuration we should review to ensure ZPR0 is applied correctly?

Here is Part of the payload sent via EDI:

<E1EDP01 SEGMENT="1">
<POSEX>10</POSEX>
<ACTION>001</ACTION>
<PSTYP>0</PSTYP>
<MENGE>120</MENGE>
<MENEE>MTK</MENEE>
<VPREI>19.7</VPREI>
<PEINH>1</PEINH>
<E1EDP02 SEGMENT="1">
<QUALF>044</QUALF>
<BELNR>APCDA012324176_SL404</BELNR>
</E1EDP02>
<E1EDP19 SEGMENT="1">
<QUALF>003</QUALF>
<IDTNR>5414995372915</IDTNR>
</E1EDP19>
<E1EDPT1 SEGMENT="1">
<TDID>Z001</TDID>
<E1EDPT2 SEGMENT="1">
<TDLINE>KUDOS Gris moyen</TDLINE>
</E1EDPT2>
</E1EDPT1>
</E1EDP01>

Thank you in advance!

Kind regards

Safa

entry.title: Display item of content page on master page in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Displaying a Text Field/Value from the Content Form on the Master Page in Adobe Forms.
Sometimes it can be tricky to display a field from the content page on the master page in Adobe Forms, because the master page does not contain any XML structure in the Data View (except for elements like the logo and footer). The master page does not have direct access to invoice, billing, or other master data.

Assumption: You have already created both a master form template and a content form template according to your business needs.

In this example, I have created:

  • Content form template: YY1_CINV_BILL_BE

  • Master form template: YY1_INVOICE_MASTER_FORM

Scenario

We need to print the invoice number on the master form template (instead of the content form template) because the requirement is to show the invoice number on every page of the PDF output.


Step 1: Download the templates

Download both the content form template and the master form template. After downloading, extract the XDP files and open the master form template in Adobe LiveCycle Designer.

You will notice that the DataConnection Node does not contain the invoice number, because it is part of the content form data. 

 

Now open the content form in Adobe LiveCycle Designer. Here, you can see that the invoice number is available in the content form — but our requirement is to also display it on the master form.

Step 2: Bind the invoice number in the content form
Add a Text Field (name it InvoiceNumber) on the content form and bind it to the correct XML node for the invoice number.

Step 3: Create a hidden subform: 

If you want the invoice number to appear only on the master page and not on the content page, create a hidden subform.

  • Set the subform’s visibility to hidden.

  • Drag the InvoiceNumber text field into this hidden subform.

If you also want the invoice number on the content form, you can skip creating the hidden subform.

Step 4: Add the text field in the master form

Open the master form template in Adobe LiveCycle Designer and add a Text Field (also named InvoiceNumber).

In this example, I have added the field to both mst1 and mst2, since the invoice number must appear on both master pages.

Step 5: Write JavaScript to access content form data
Select the textField of the Master Form Template and then write one Javascript code in order to access the data of content form. The Javscript code is written in the Initialize event of the InvoiceNumber textField.

The path (Form.HeaderSubform.HiddenSubform.InvoiceNumber.rawValue) comes from inspecting the content form structure. We simply reference the rawValue of that node.

Step 6: Upload and test

Once the changes are complete in both the content form and the master form:

  1. Save the forms.

  2. Upload them to the public cloud using the Maintain Form Templates app.

 



Finally, test your invoice PDF using the Manage Invoicing Document app. You will now be able to see the invoice number printed on the left side of every master page.
Please let me know if you have any other solution for this requirement.
Happy Learning !!


Thanks,
Shubham

entry.title: HU Label Printing via Third-Party Application in S/4HANA Public Cloud EWM
entry.content:
Dear SAP Support,

 

We are working on S/4HANA Public Cloud – Extended Warehouse Management (EWM).
We have configured RF transactions for Handling Unit (HU) receiving and internal warehouse movements.

 

Our business requirement is to print HU labels using a third-party labeling solution, such as NiceLabel or Loftware, instead of directly printing from S/4HANA Public Cloud.

 

We would like to understand:

 

  1.  

  2. What standard options are available in S/4HANA Public Cloud to integrate warehouse label printing with external applications?

  3.  

  4. How we can push HU label data from S/4HANA Public Cloud to an external labeling application for printing.

 

Kindly provide guidance and recommended approach for this requirement.

Regards

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: PATCH Fails for Statistical Condition Types in API_SALES_ORDER_SRV
entry.content:
When attempting to update a Sales Order Pricing Element via the API_SALES_ORDER_SRV service using a PATCH request, the operation fails for certain condition types even though other condition types update successfully.

Example: Updating ConditionRateValue for a specific condition type fails, while other condition types in the same request succeed.

  • Error message: "Field CONDITIONTYPE is not an input field"

The issue occurs specifically when the condition type in the pricing procedure is marked as Statistical.

Has anyone encountered this behavior in the Public Cloud version of SAP S/4HANA? Is there a way to update Statistical condition types via API, or is there an official limitation?


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: In CBAR Return Delivery, No FI Document is Generated
entry.content:
While using the CBAR standard Return Order type with reference to a billing document, the system creates the return order and delivery in the background.
After posting the goods receipt (PGR), the stock is placed in Blocked Stock.
We then move it to Unrestricted Stock using a stock transfer with movement type 343 E.

However, in the return delivery’s goods issue document, no FI document is generated.
Why is this happening and how can we generate an FI document for a return delivery ? 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.
